record.COMMENT: not able to run inventory command in the Datamart serv

text.line: We are not able to run inventory command in the Datamart server for a
specific profile name : CISCO_DCNsIt is giving error aborted .
Please help us solve this issue ASAP.

Action Taken: Sent mail to customer.
This is to acknowledge the receipt of your PMR 86731,999,744. We will
assist you to resolve your issue.
Please provide us below details for investigation of issue,
1) Provide us the command which you have used to run the inventory.
3) Output on the terminal or error which you are getting for profile
Action plan: Wait for customer Response.

This email was also sent to: "Noccnms.Mis"
Action Taken: sent mail to customer.
As discussed on call, we are degrading the severity 1 to severity2.
Also we have completed our investigation and below are the findings.
1) From the logs, looks like either dataLoad server is down or some
2) Run below commands and check if collector is running
3) If there is no pvmd process running, start using "pvmdmgr start"
4) Then check dataLoad host is reachable from dataMart host - telnet
5) At last, run inventory in debug mode - inventory -noX -action all
Action Plan: Waiting for customer response.

you will get an output like:

This email was also sent to: "Noccnms.Mis"
Now , we are able to login into the data loader (10.18.41.137) . When I
ran the command : ps -ef|grep -i pvmd , the output is as below :
Please tell us , further , how to proceed .
Action Taken: Sent mail to Customer.
As you can see in the grepped output pvmd process is not running.
1)As a pvuser , source the dataload env.
2) Start using "pvmdmgr start" command & check its staus by pvmdctrl
3) Then check dataLoad host is reachable from dataMart host - telnet
4) If yes, run inventory in debug mode - inventory -noX -action all
5) Then Collect & upload TraceInventory.log & proviso.log files.
Let us know if face any issue.
Action Plan: Wait for Customer Reponse.

Again it started giving the same error as below :
And the result is same on 5 different systems .
Action Taken: Sent mail to Customer.
1. As you can see error in previous screenshot,
fork(Cleates new process) is not able start ls command
This issue in not related to TNPM, Its on machine
2. In recently provided Screenshot, Server unexpectedly closed network
There seams to be issue in connectivity with SSH server.
For both the above issues Please contact your system administrator.
Action Plan: Wait for Customer Response.

This email was also sent to: "Noccnms.Mis"
As discussed on call , please let us know if there is a management IP
for the proviso/netcool servers . We can login via management IP and
kill the process which is consuming that much memory .
There is no such management IP or service in TNPM for managing this
issue. & The issue of "fork: Not enough space" & "connectivity with SSH
server" is not related to TNPM but an issue with system.
As your System Engineers are looking into the same. Lets wait for there
Action Plan: Wait for Customer Response.

We are not able to run inventory command in the Datamart server for a
specific profile name : CISCO_DCNsIt is giving error aborted .
Please help us solve this issue ASAP.
1) From the logs, looks like either dataLoad server is down
2) Run below commands and check if collector is running
3) If there is no pvmd process running, start using "pvmdmgr start"
4) Then check dataLoad host is reachable from dataMart host - telnet
5) At last, run inventory in debug mode - inventory -noX -action all
closing PMR with customer closure response.
